results.title: Australian super 8 films 1981-1986
results.brief_description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. It attempts to be a representative survey of prominent filmmakers, themes and style. A rare and important documentation of a fertile aspect of Australian film and visual arts activities. Curated by Michael Hutak, Super 8 Group Australia.

results.title: Wool: fashion's choice for '62
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Models strut the latest wool fashions, using locations around Melbourne as their backdrop. Some of these localities include the banks of the Yarra, Captain Cook’s Cottage, St Kilda Pier, King’s Domain, the Botanical and Exhibition Gardens, and the Myer Music Bowl. Commentated by Roger Climpson, Fashion adviser: Sybil Jackson and photographed by George Heath.

results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, David Adams, Nick Bosustow and Pyramid Films

results.title: Melbourne: festival city
results.creator_credit: Gordon C. Lloyd, Cinesound and Tourist Development Authority of Victoria
results.brief_description: Melbourne’s Moomba festival - the city comes alive with processions, regattas, the Herald open air art show, music under the stars at the Myer Music Bowl, and the crowning of the Moomba Queen. The film also shows some of the Melbourne landscape and the background of daily life; Melbourne’s economic expansion; the Melbourne Cup, the race for which the nation stands still; Australian Rules Football, drawing crowds of over 50,000; fine golf courses; hunting; night life. It closes with a coverage of the Moomba procession, with all its varied floats, including the Bunyip and the Chinese dragon.

results.title: Glimpses of Australia. [No. 02?]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items include: 1. A lesson in geography - shows the size of Australia in relation to Scandinavia and Europe. 2. Warburton District - located on the Great Dividing Range, Victoria, shows scenery and inhabitants. 3. The Princes Highway - from Lakes Entrance to Narooma inlet. Shows Lakes Entrance locals and holiday-makers; an Australian First Nations person fishing with a spear; Narooma’s beautiful inlet; oyster fishing and eating. 4. Animal bandits - animals dance to the sound of birds; they form a band but their tunes are unbearable until they attend Professor Heron’s school of music.

results.title: Grapes are growing
results.creator_credit: Peter Menzies, John Kingsford-Smith, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of Australia’s wine industry. Shows the factors leading to high quality grapes; the process of wine making in which grapes are tested, weighed, transported, crushed, fermented, stored and bottled ready for use. Includes the traditional method of making ‘champagne’ and the importance of the Australian Wine Research Institute and Roseworthy College.

results.title: Heads
results.creator_credit: David Corke, George Dixon and Melbourne Repertory Film Unit
results.brief_description: An experimental film by a group of young Victorian filmmakers. Nonchalantly, the cleaner dusts the works of art created by ancient Greek potters, Renaissance painters and modern sculptors. Each piece marks the stage in our progress as percipient thinking beings: civilisations mature and die - but we survive, at least until today. As the cleaner blows dust from the ear of Epstein’s Einstein, he is ignorant of the terrible forces such a mind has unleashed; for good or ill these forces can, almost, be directed by a toss of a coin.

results.title: Stop the drop: a concert for nuclear disarmament
results.brief_description: Footage from a benefit rock concert for the anti-uranium movement is shown and is combined with interviews with the performers of the concert. The concert was held at the Sidney Myer Music Bowl in Melbourne and the performers included bands such as “Goanna”, “Midnight Oil” “INXS”, “Men at work” and “Redgum”.

results.title: Early Melbourne mansions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Looks at three Melbourne mansions, Toorak House, Trewalla and Illawarra, including brief histories.

results.title: Angry Boy
results.creator_credit: Alexander Hammid, Aram Boyajian, Irving Jacoby and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: An analysis of the emotional disturbance of a boy whose hostility finds expression in terms of stealing. Through the help of a child guidance clinic, this hostility is traced back to the source in the home life of the child where a good and well-intentioned mother has been taking out her hostility toward her mother and her husband in an over-protective attitude toward the child. The film then develops as it describes the process in which the child is helped by guidance personnel in his way to recovery. Cinematography by Peter Glushanok.
